definition: 7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: We started our trip at dawn in order to get there before noon.
sentences.chinese: 为了在午前到达该处，我们黎明即动身上路。

sentences.english: I also request the people of the United States to display the flag at half-staff from their homes for the customary forenoon period.
sentences.chinese: 我也要求美国人民在自己的住所依午前传统降半旗。

sentences.english: I am required to act before noon tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我必须在明天午前做出决定。

sentences.english: For some people the peak comes during the forenoon.
sentences.chinese: 对于有些人的高峰期会在午前到来。

sentences.english: Some people go to bed late at night and get up late in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 某些人在晚上后上床并且午前起来。

sentences.english: I couldn't see myself coming back before noon.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我午前不可能赶回来。

sentences.english: Seller will withdraw offer unless accept by tomorrow noon.
sentences.chinese: 除非明日午前接受，否则卖主将撤消报价。

sentences.english: DAWN】We started our trip at dawn in order to get there before noon.
sentences.chinese: 为了在午前到达该处，我们黎明即动身上路。

definition: 11 am-1 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
1-3 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
7-9 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
9-11 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
3-5 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
(of a store, stock market etc) to open for trading/to make the first transaction of the day
5-7 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
5-7 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
devastating setback/slump (in stock market etc)/crushing defeat/to cause a serious setback/to plummet
